list_definition.definition: a tiny hole, especially of a sweat gland in the skin

list_ex_of_english: Staphylococcal alpha-toxin: formation of the heptameric pore is partially cooperative and proceeds through multiple intermediate stages.
Upon excitation, it permits the passage of ions through the channel pore (b).
Bulges are present along the tubules where cercariae are present and a birth pore can be seen at the terminal end of the sporocyst branches.
At the pore corners, the initial impingement angles are being replaced by lower angles during quenching.
Also, the small pore spaces in the same rock could allow water to exist despite low atmospheric pressure due to capillary action.
In addition, the dielectric constant in the pore region should be set to 1 where the water molecules are represented explicitly (but see discussion below).
The nerve ring and the excretory pore were 156 and 222 from the anterior extremity, respectively.
The two membranes join at the nuclear pore membrane, which surrounds the nuclear pore complexes.
